data.title: Do not call MakeCurrent if context is already current on iOS
data.body:
`GraphicsContext.MakeCurrent` is not free and doesn't test if the context is already current.

This change also removes the `Obsolete` attribute on the `MakeCurrent()` method: the comment is enough to convey what needs to be done here and doesn't generate superfluous warnings (the warning generated by such an attribute is misleading in this case).

Note: on Android, MonoGame does call `GraphicsContext.IsCurrent()` however there is a bug in the OpenTK implementation that will make it return false in all cases. A workaround is explained [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3091937/call-to-check-if-a-current-eglcontext-exists-in-android) but requires to fix OpenTK. It might be possible to go around OpenTK though.

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline Tool] Rename support plus few bug fixes
data.body:
Stuff done:
  • Implemented a breaking system for undo/redo system
  • Implemented "Rename" option
  • Removed unused widget
  • Fixed "Save As" not changing tree root name
  • Fixed "Remove" not removing sub folders

data.title: Async dispose causes concurrent mod exception
data.body:
During the async dispose of resources in iOS (OpenGL) you will get a concurrent modification exception during the PlatformDeleteRenderTarget. I have fixed it in our fork of MG. You can see my bug report here:

https://github.com/Cocos2DXNA/cocos2d-xna/issues/471

and you can see my changes to the OpenGL GraphicsDevice here:

https://github.com/Cocos2DXNA/MonoGame/commit/47bec75605efabd17656356e955affec0248f57a

The Activate/Dispose/Resolve methods all access or make changes to the glFrameBuffers dictionary, and they do so without any regard to protection during an async dispose. I found that this exception occurs about 1 in 200 activate/dispose operations.

data.body:
After update to latest MG and protobuild, the 2MGFX project (contained in MG.Windows) will not compile. It is missing the VirtualFileSystem and VirtualFile classes.

data.title: Pipeline - System.Exception could not load .spritefont
data.body:
Windows 8.1, newest prebuild dev build.
Font [menufont.spritefont](https://github.com/CartBlanche/MonoGame-Samples/blob/master/GameStateManagement/Content/menufont.spritefont)
Picture of the problem: http://i.imgur.com/kFuy03w.png

Is the spritefont building completely busted, or does it not like certain .spritefont files? Or am I perhaps missing something?

Also the pipeline window got the black plague after 3.2 :(

data.title: [WP8.1] Portrait size not correct
(WP8.1, WP10) Virtual navigation bar hides part of the game screen
data.body:
When using a device with virtual navigation bar, part of the game is obscured behind the virtual navigation bar.

The virtual bar may or may not be automatically hidden depending on user configuration, so I suppose this should be handled by monogame.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/dn792127.aspx
"Note that SuppressSystemOverlays only has this effect on the nav bar if Settings > Navigation Bar > Auto Hide is set on the phone."

data.title: Windows 10 Support Pt. 3
data.body:
This PR fixes the Windows installer to install the Windows 10 UAP assemblies.

I setup a temporary Win10 build agent to take care of the Win10 build... the main Windows build then copies those artifacts across when building the installer.

Also cleaned some old stuff in the installer from the old XNA content project support.

data.title: Sprites not rendering with rebuilt effects
[3.3] OpenTK crashes if you exit on windows without calling dispose on textures
data.body:
I don't use the content pipeline and I just load textures by hand using `Texture2D.FromStream` or `new Texture2D`. With 3.2 I had no problems. When I upgraded to 3.3 I suddenly get this exception from OpenTK when I close the game window:

```
An unhandled exception of type 'OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContextException' occurred in OpenTK.dll

Additional information: Failed to make context 131072 current. Error: 6
```

data.title: Pipeline Tool Start Page
data.body:
I was thinking that instead of opening the last opened project on startup we present the user with a page that offers all recent projects (and maybe MonoGame News?).

@tomspilman @nkast I would like to hear your opinion on this.

data.title: Windows 10 Support Pt.2
data.body:
This PR cleans up the template project a bit removing some references to SharpDX and removing the unnecessary AppBar XAML.

We also added Win10 building into the build script.  It won't run until we get the Win10 build agent running.

data.title: Winodows 10 UAP Support Pt.1
data.body:
This is the first pass at Windows 10 UAP support.
- Added latest SharpDX for UAP builds.
- Added Win10 support to Protobuild.
- Fixed DX path to use SwapChainPanel.

The latest SharpDX has some changes that caused more `#if` statements.  We can in theory use the new SharpDX assemblies on all Windows Store/Phone apps which is what we should try to do in the future.

I need to submit an official patch to the Protobuild project so we don't have to maintain a custom xslt files to support Win10.

The build server has no Win10 support, so it is not building the Win10 binaries yet and we cannot include them in the installer until we do.  I'll look to solve this next.

~~~Also I will write up a VS project template soon.~~~

data.title: Archive The Old Forums
data.body:
We need to find a tool to archive the content (text, links, images) of the old forums:

 http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions

We can then take them down to avoid confusing users as to where to ask questions.

The static archive can then be put on the new site in a read only state.

data.title: SharpDX from nuget not working
data.body:
Hello,

I installed Monogame 3.3 on fresh install of Visual Studio 2013 and I created Monogame Windows Project. After build and start I got an error that dependency is missing (SharpDX). So I used NuGet, it downloads latest version of SharpDX (2.6.3). After start, app throws exception:
Could not load file or assembly 'SharpDX, Version=2.5.1.0

Why monogame strictly dependent on version 2.5.1.0? By the way, there is no package in NuGet with that version and very close version 2.5.0 not working.

Current workaround is to add reference to SharpDX libraries located in "C:\Program Files (x86)\MonoGame\v3.0\Assemblies\Windows\".

data.title: Official repo for MonoGame extensions ?
data.body:
Some people are conservative and dont like new classes or method etc.. but some peoples do not. The good examples of thing to be implemented are PrimitiveBatch,Circle,animation classes for skinned model,BumpMapEffect. I agreed there is too much things for single framework library - So a good variant is to create separate repo for all extensions.
Here is few notes... I suggest

1) (most important)Link it with the official website of MonoGame and mark it visible(it must be official repo by MonoGame creators, otherwise nobody cares about it).
2) It must work on all platforms
3) It must be easy to install and use.
4) No extension methods(because it is messy and could conflicts with other libs). Use static classes with Ex ending.
5) (maybe)Divide it on separate assemblies(for peoples who does not need full functionality).

The main problem could be less developer activity and error checking for the first time. But I think the benefits of this repo will be huge(raw MonoGame couldnt do so much from a box) in the future.

PS. I heard either @dellis1972 or @KonajuGames saying they have some sort of repo - but this is not be completed without regard of 1) rule.

Share your ideas :)
